intro: Phyllanthus quangtriensis, commonly known as the Quang Tri starleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, forested areas and thrives in tropical climates. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
